bioghist.p: Mary Rebecca Darby Smith (d. 1886) was the daughter of James and Hannah Logan Smith, and the great great granddaughter of James Logan, statesman and secretary to William Penn. In her will, Smith bequeathed her collection of books and albums to the Loganian Library, which had been absorbed by the Library Company of Philadelphia in 1792. Smith was the author of several books, including Brief Memorials of Departed Worth, a memorial of her mother.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of five scrapbooks kept by M. Rebecca Darby Smith. Volumes contain portraits, landscapes, and architectural views. Included are prints, photographs, cabinet cards, newspaper clippings, sketches, watercolors, and one silhouette in cloth. Subjects include American, British, and French literary, political, and military figures, views of British towns and castles, views of Philadelphia and surrounding areas.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
